intro: Malvastrum schaffneri, commonly known as Schaffner's mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
